segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 36
segments.en: Linked Discourses 36

segments.pli: 2. Rahogatavagga
segments.en: 2. In Private

segments.pli: 11. Rahogatasutta
segments.en: 11. In Private

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
segments.en: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.

segments.pli: tisso vedanā vuttā bhagavatā.
segments.en: The Buddha has spoken of three feelings.

segments.pli: Sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
segments.en: Pleasant, painful, and neutral feeling.

segments.pli: imā tisso vedanā vuttā bhagavatā.
segments.en: These are the three feelings the Buddha has spoken of.

segments.pli: Vuttaṃ kho panetaṃ bhagavatā:
segments.en: But the Buddha has also said:

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci vedayitaṃ taṃ dukkhasmin’ti.
segments.en: ‘Suffering includes whatever is felt.’

segments.pli: Kiṃ nu kho etaṃ bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
segments.en: What was the Buddha referring to when he said this?”

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci vedayitaṃ taṃ dukkhasmin’”ti?
“Sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu.
segments.en: “Good, good, mendicant!

segments.pli: Tisso imā, bhikkhu, vedanā vuttā mayā.
segments.en: I have spoken of these three feelings.

segments.pli: Sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
segments.en: Pleasant, painful, and neutral feeling.

segments.pli: imā tisso vedanā vuttā mayā.
segments.en: These are the three feelings I have spoken of.

segments.pli: Vuttaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhu, mayā:
segments.en: But I have also said:

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci vedayitaṃ, taṃ dukkhasmin’ti.
segments.en: ‘Suffering includes whatever is felt.’

segments.pli: Taṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhu, mayā saṅkhārānaṃyeva aniccataṃ sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
segments.en: When I said this I was referring to the impermanence of conditions, to the fact that conditions are

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci vedayitaṃ taṃ dukkhasmin’ti.
Taṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhu, mayā saṅkhārānaṃyeva khayadhammataṃ … pe …
segments.en: liable to end,

segments.pli: vayadhammataṃ … pe …
segments.en: vanish,

segments.pli: virāgadhammataṃ … pe …
segments.en: fade away,

segments.pli: nirodhadhammataṃ … pe …
segments.en: cease,

segments.pli: vipariṇāmadhammataṃ sandhāya bhāsitaṃ:
segments.en: and perish.

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci vedayitaṃ taṃ dukkhasmin’ti.
Atha kho pana, bhikkhu, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ nirodho akkhāto.
segments.en: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased.

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vitakkavicārā niruddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have ceased.

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa pīti niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has ceased.

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa assāsapassāsā niruddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has ceased.

segments.pli: Ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samāpannassa rūpasaññā niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has ceased.

segments.pli: Viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samāpannassa ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has ceased.

segments.pli: Ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samāpannassa viññāṇañcāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has ceased.

segments.pli: Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samāpannassa ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has ceased.

segments.pli: Saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca niruddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo niruddho hoti, doso niruddho hoti, moho niruddho hoti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhu, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ vūpasamo akkhāto.
segments.en: And I have also explained the progressive stilling of conditions.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā vūpasantā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled.

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vitakkavicārā vūpasantā honti … pe …
segments.en: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have stilled. …

segments.pli: saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca vūpasantā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have stilled.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo vūpasanto hoti, doso vūpasanto hoti, moho vūpasanto hoti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.

segments.pli: Chayimā, bhikkhu, passaddhiyo.
segments.en: There are these six levels of tranquility.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vitakkavicārā paṭippassaddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa pīti paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa assāsapassāsā paṭippassaddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca paṭippassaddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo paṭippassaddho hoti, doso paṭippassaddho hoti, moho paṭippassaddho hotī”ti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed,…

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant wonders how there can be three kinds of feeling, yet all of them are suffering.
